intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. subsagittatum, commonly known as the arrowhead hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are heart-shaped and gradually reduced upwards. Its flowers are yellow, forming a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces small, oval seeds in a pappus. It thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often in temperate climates.
